result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:12 PM   Attorney Terry Nussberger appeared along with his client Tony Lovelien.   ADA Emily Nelson appeared in person.  Matter set for bond hearing.   Attorney Nussberger made argument on bond.   Court will address bond on 3/29/22 at 1:00 PM.  Bond will also be addressed at that time.   Adj. 2:13 PM
Bail/bond hearing on March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by Atty Nussberber
From Atty Nussberger
No contact with SL or any other minors.

1:02pm.  State appears by ADA Nelson.  DE appears from RC Jail with Atty Nussberger.  State will be asking for a $15,000.00 cash bond,no contact with the victim SL or any minors.  DE does have a criminal history, believes DE to be a flight risk.  Atty Nussberger argues bond, objects to the large cash bond, no objections to the non monetary conditions, asking the court for a $5000.00 sign bond or cash bond of $1000.00 or less.  The court is satisfied that cash is necessary, will order a $10,000.00 cash bond, no contact with SL or any other minors.  Atty Nelson would like the court to make a finding concerning SJL.  The court will appoint a GAL for the victim.  Set for March 22, 2022 @ 1:00pm for Init App.
